intro: Sarcinula striata, commonly known as the striated sarcinula, is a species of seagrass found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Zosteraceae and is characterized by its ribbon-like leaves that are often ribbed or striated, giving it its common name. The plant forms dense underwater meadows that provide critical habitat for a variety of marine life. Its rhizomes spread horizontally along the seafloor, anchoring the plant and facilitating nutrient absorption. Sarcinula striata plays an important role in stabilizing coastal sediments and maintaining water quality in its ecosystem.
